content.prompt: Mosca's comment "Riches are in fortune/A greater good than wisdom is in nature" (lines 28-29) does which of the following?

choices.label: Asserts that riches are the equivalent of wisdom.
Implies that acquiring riches is more natural than acquiring good fortune.
Suggests that wisdom can add riches to nature.
Contrasts a gift conferred by fortune with a gift conferred by nature.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain the function of contrasts within a text.
